title: Future opportunities will benefit whole Torbay community - Kitsons - Devon Live
text:
At Kitsons Jonathan Dickson, James Cross, Corri Pedrick Share Get Daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
KITSONS Solicitors has come a long way since being established in 1826 at Vaughan Parade in Torquay by William Kitson who became known as the ‘maker of Torquay’. 
In April 2001, Kitsons merged with the long established Torquay firm Hutchings & Plum founded by Ernest Hutchings, who first practised in Torquay, in 1899. 
The merged firms practised as Kitsons Hutchings until April 2010 when, to coincide with the relocation of the firm’s head office to Edginswell Business Park, the firm rebranded to become ‘Kitsons’ with the strap line ‘The Way Solicitors Should Be’. 
Kitsons today has 118 staff members spread across its offices in Torquay, Exeter and Plymouth. 
We are recognised in the Legal 500 and Chambers and Partners legal publications as one of the South West’s leading law firms providing outstanding legal advice and support to both commercial and private clients. Kitsons (Image: Kitsons) 
WHY WE SUPPORT NOW IS THE TIME: 
Kitsons’ roots are firmly and deeply in Torbay. Many of our solicitors and staff have given their time over the years to the chamber of commerce, the Business Forum, South Devon College, to schools within the Bay, and to other committees and organisations making Torbay the place it is and the place it wants to become. 
We as a firm are supporting ‘Now is the Time’ because we believe in Torbay. We believe that we have future opportunities which will benefit the whole community including business. 
With the possible headwinds of Brexit, what better time to support a project within the Bay that will benefit us all? We have excellent education centres, businesses and a community that cares. 
Now certainly is the time. Kitsons Marjorie Creek Solicitor and Lynn Smith, Partner 
NOTABLE SUCCESSES: 
Kitsons’ success is that we have grown strategically and in personnel in the face of the changes and challenges to the legal market. We embrace investing in our people. 
In Torbay, tourism is being transformed, education has been modernised, and we have hospital and medical services to be proud of. Our strategic view is to grow through being dynamic and progressive, trusted and respected, and being a great place to work. 
Torbay can be exactly the same. 
WHAT WE HOPE THE CAMPAIGN WILL ACHIEVE: 
The Now is the Time campaign, if it creates the momentum that we would hope, and we can see no reason why it shouldn’t, can assist in supporting the delivery of university status for South Devon College and obtaining Coastal Enterprise Zone status for the Bay. 
One of the results will be the generation of growth and jobs.
